page.title: 18HOUSING AT BRIDGE END.
page.content: At Bridge End, Dalston, there are many different styles of houses, ranging from the old to the very new. There are several old, detached houses along the Dalston road (B5299). Along by the River Caldew, at Bridge End, there is the Forge Green and the Council Estate. These houses are whitewashed and are semi-detached. The Forge Green is an old sandstone house that is owned by the Parish Council. They let it out once a year. The newest housing estate in Dalston is about the newest housing in the whole of our area. It is called "Forge Mill" and is situated at Bridge End. These houses were built in 1980. They are detached, modern houses that have built-in garages.
